alert.note: Alert for Central Willamette Valley; Greater Portland Metro Area (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 9:21PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL CLACKAMAS... NORTHEASTERN YAMHILL...NORTHERN MARION AND SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON COUNTIES THROUGH 945 PM PDT... At 920 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Butteville, or 13 miles west of Oregon City, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Hillsboro, Beaverton, Tigard, Tualatin, Newberg, Wilsonville, Yamhill, Butteville, Sherwood, Dundee, King City, Donald, Farmington, Scholls, and Aloha. In Oregon this includes Interstate 5 between mile markers 280 and 288. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Central Willamette Valley; Greater Portland Metro Area
